text: Tried their homemade mee hoon kueh ($4.50) with an onsen egg ($1). Mee hoon kueh is thin and extremely springy. The soup base is less salty, naturally sweet and light. Every component works well together and leaves a pleasant aftertaste. Overall 9.5/10.
Too salty and the mee hoon kueh isn't actually handmade..

I'm impressed by their Dao Ma Qie (Handmade ban mian). The soup base taste smooth and gentle. I even finish their soup. Their ban mian reminds of my hometown Malaysia. They insist to put 树仔菜 in the Ban Mian. And the chilli sauce was perfect! FRESH.
But one could be better would be
if they 捏 the ban mian entirely, it will make the Ban mian more chewy. Now they seems like half machine half manual way.
Taste delicious especially the noodle. Acceptable price and good service :))
Finally can get my hometown flavour Ban Mee at SG AMK… Especially Chilli Ban Mee is my favourite…
